items.sentence: Tom carefully cut the fabric with a pair of scissors.
Tom closed the magazine and put it into his knapsack.
Tom could tell that Mary wanted to be somewhere else.
Tom could write his name when he was three years old.
Tom and Mary are outside. They\'re playing badminton.
Tom and Mary didn\'t know that much about each other.
Excuse me, but let me have another look at the photo.
Giving advice to him is like talking to a brick wall.
He caught the first train and got there just in time.
He complained about the room being too hot and humid.
He dreaded having to spend Christmas in the hospital.
He failed the exam because he had not studied enough.
What\'re you going to do during your summer vacation?
What\'s the best way to get to the airport from here?
Tom doesn\'t know why Mary didn\'t come to the party.
Tom doesn\'t mind the cold, but Mary can\'t stand it.
When I got home, I noticed that I had lost my wallet.
When I got to the bus stop, the bus had already left.
Which one do you prefer, the red one or the blue one?
Last Sunday, Mary and I went to the library together.
